moves.1... Nf6: Fighting for control of the middle board here.
moves.2. e3: Protecting my other pawn, opening the way for my LSB.
moves.2... d5: Good response; d5 is always a good square to occupy.
moves.3. Bb5+: Why not, just to force him to make a play that is different from what he intended?
moves.3... Nbd7: Getting his knight in play while protecting his king. Good play on black's part.
moves.4. c3: Why did I do this? I inadvertently blocked my b-column knight from moving...
moves.5. Nf3: Paving the way for a kingside castle...
moves.5... a6: Threatening my bishop and diverting my attention...
moves.7. Ne5: Challenging him; how will he respond?
moves.7... Be7: I don't know what his bishop is doing...
moves.9. Nd2: Trying to get my knight out of there.
moves.10. Nb3: My knight needed two moves to get out.
moves.11. Bd2: Trying to get my DSB out; my pawns are not making it easy
moves.12. Qc2: I didn't know what to do, since his bishop prevents me from castling. I thought maybe I could queenside castle, instead.
moves.13. dxc5: I take his pawn, creating an opening for my knight
moves.13... Bxc5: And he responds, making it harder for my knight again.
moves.14... Rxc5: Unfortunately, that gave him an opportunity to get his rook out.
moves.15. e4: Trying to clear up some pawn congestion.
moves.16... Rd5: Black is trying to gain an advantage here, using a combination of queen and d5 rook to take my bishop. (rook takes my bishop and I can't retaliate)
moves.17. Qc2: I see through his ploy and move to stop it.
moves.17... Bd3: He's trying to keep me from keeping him from executing his plan.
moves.18. Qd1: Move my queen out of the way.
moves.20. Qc1: At the very least, I might be able to get him to sacrifice his queen for mine.
moves.20... Qxc3+: Smart move to make, but then I get his queen without losing mine.
moves.21... Rfd8: Trying to make up for the loss of his queen
moves.22. Rb1: Aiming for his pawn at b7
moves.23. Rd1: Not sure what I was trying to accomplish here
moves.25... Bxa2: I left my pawn unattended; he took it
moves.26. Ke2: Trying to prevent my king from being trapped
moves.26... Bc4+: Put me in check because he could
moves.28. Ra1: Getting my rook into play; aiming for a back rank checkmate
moves.29. Qxa5: This was a mistake; I should have protected my bishop first.
moves.29... Rxd4+: He takes the bishop and checks me
moves.30... h6: Giving his king an escape route
moves.31. Qa8+: One move too late on the back rank check, but I think, "why not?"
moves.32. Ra6: I didn't know what to do at this point, so I did this
moves.33. Qc6: Still didn't know what to do next
moves.33... Bxa6: Accidentally let him take my rook; oops.
moves.34... f5: Moving his pawn; perhaps he wants to distract me.
moves.38. h3: It would be nice to have at least one pawn left, so I move it.
moves.40. Kc5: Aiming for his d pawn now.
moves.40... Rd2: Trying to prevent me from taking it.
moves.41... Rh2: Trying to take my pawn again
moves.44. Qf5+: I discovered this brilliant move on accident; all I was intending to do was to put him in check, but I ended up pinning his rook, too.
moves.45... h5: Don't know what he's doing here. A better move might have been to try and promote his f-column pawn.
moves.46. Qxf3: Taking his unprotected pawn; he resigns.
